item.title: How To Watch the 2025 NBA Preseason
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The NBA preseason marks the perfect opportunity to rekindle your passion for your favorite basketball teams. Fortunately, you can watch most preseason games across local and national channels.

The post How To Watch the 2025 NBA Preseason appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

I get excited for the NBA season every October. It’s almost as exciting as Halloween for me—almost. And the best way to prepare for the marathon 82-game season is by keeping a close eye on the preseason.

The NBA preseason gives fans the first glimpses of new players, new coaches, or young players in new roles looking to make a leap. Even though the games don’t count, they at times could provide clues into whether a team will have a good or awful season.

If you’re not attending a preseason game in person, this guide is for you. I’ll give you the best ways to watch games on TV or streaming, and provide you with a full schedule of games.

Jump to:

  • NBA preseason channels
  • NBA preseason TV schedule
  • Best NBA preseason TV plans
  • Watch the NBA preseason for free

Score the best NBA TV plan!

Enter your zip code below to view your area’s top TV providers for watching local and national NBA coverage.

What channels are NBA preseason games on?

You can watch nationally televised NBA preseason games on NBA TV, ESPN, ESPN2, and Peacock. Due to NBA’s new media deal, TNT will no longer be a hub for NBA games.

Keep in mind, though, that most preseason matchups air locally on each team’s regional sports network (RSN) or over-the-air affiliate.

Pro tip: NBA preseason games that air locally also stream on NBA League Pass for out-of-market fans.

2025 NBA preseason schedule

This season’s NBA preseason calendar spans the first few weeks of October. Teams will play various home and away games, with several happening in non-NBA markets. Additional preseason games will occur internationally or feature teams from foreign leagues. It all leads to the start of the regular season on October 21.

Hit the drop-down menus below for the full 2025 NBA preseason TV schedule—including game times and channel listings. Most games appearing on NBA League Pass also air on each participating team’s in-market NBA channel.

New this year is the addition of Peacock to the schedule.

Best TV plans for watching the NBA preseason

Stream with DIRECTV is my favorite way to watch the NBA preseason. It carries every national NBA channel and most RSNs. With plans starting at $69.99 a month, Stream with DIRECTV is kinda pricey for simply watching preseason games. But it’ll set you up nicely for the NBA regular season.

Ultimately, the best TV plan for watching any sports league depends on your ride-or-die teams. Using the schedule above for reference, here are my three viewing recommendations based on game type.

  1. Local games: Stream with DIRECTV and Fubo offer the most RSN coverage of any streaming service. Though, some local games stream free online and air on antenna TV channels—making a paid TV subscription unnecessary for certain fans.
  2. Out-of-market games: NBA League Pass is the league’s out-of-market TV package designed for fans who don’t live near their preferred team. The service also comes with NBA TV for additional NBA and WNBA coverage.
  3. National games: Any TV service that offers ESPN and NBA TV will get you nationally televised NBA games. Sling TV offers the cheapest way to get those channels with its Sling Orange plan ($45.99/mo.) and Sports Extra add-on ($11.00 a month). You’re also gonna need Peacock for any games streaming there.

Which TV providers carry NBA preseason games?

TV providers that offer ESPN and NBA TV will get you some NBA preseason games. Services like DIRECTV, Fubo, and Spectrum offer more coverage through RSNs, but channel lineups and game availability can vary based on your location.

Provider coverage varies by location, so enter your zip code below to see the best options in your area.

How to watch the NBA preseason for free

Some NBA teams offer free viewing options during the preseason. For instance, the Sacramento Kings stream matches on Kings.com, while the Phoenix Suns air on Arizona’s Family channels (KTVK and KPHE-LD).

If you want more robust preseason coverage, you can also opt for a free trial of Stream with DIRECTV or Fubo. Both services have an array of RSNs and national NBA networks. But you won’t get any games streaming on Peacock because that service doesn’t currently offer a free trial.

Try DIRECTV for Free

How to watch the NBA preseason FAQ

Does NBA League Pass include preseason games?

Yes, you can stream select NBA preseason games on NBA League Pass. The streaming service also includes NBA TV, which airs many NBA and WNBA matchups each year.

Is the NBA preseason on Hulu?

Yes, all NBA preseason games that air on ESPN are available to stream on Hulu + Live TV. The live TV streaming service doesn’t offer NBA TV and NBA League Pass, but you can sign up for those services separately.

When does the NBA preseason start?

The 2025 NBA preseason starts on Thursday, October 2, with a matchup between the Philadelphia 76ers and New York Knicks. in Abu Dhabi. Preseason ends on Friday, October 17, four days before NBA Opening Day.

Are NBA preseason games on Peacock?

Yes, there is at least two NBA preseason games scheduled to stream on Peacock as of publication. The first is between the Chicago Bulls and Boston Celtics on Tuesday, October 7. The second is between the Oklahoma City Thunder and Milwaukee Bucks on Tuesday, October 14.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports editor, Taylor Kujawa, researched and compiled a list of every NBA preseason game this year. Using that list, he examined channel listings and compared popular TV providers to determine the best ways to watch the NBA preseason considering the league’s new TV deal. He based his provider recommendations on game counts, pricing, and ease of use.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the Denver Nuggets in 2025–2026
item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Can the Denver Nuggets return to the NBA Finals? Here’s how to watch the 2025–2026 Denver Nuggets season.

The post How To Watch the Denver Nuggets in 2025–2026 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Now that that Serbian horse racing season is over, Denver Nuggets center Nikola Jokić can focus on the next thing—helping his team reach the NBA mountaintop again.

The Nuggets, after losing to the Minnesota Timberwolves in the playoffs last season, made some roster moves many believe can help them represent the Western Conference in the Finals in 2025–2026. They’ll need to get past the likes of the Oklahoma City Thunder, Houston Rockets, and Los Angeles Lakers, but their core is championship-tested and Jokić is still one of the best players in the league.

To keep up with all things Denver, I created this watch guide so you don’t miss a second of the Nuggets in 2025–2026.

Jump to:

  • Denver Nuggets channels
  • Denver Nuggets TV schedule
  • Watch the Denver Nuggets for free

Want to watch Denver Nuggets games on TV?

Enter your zip code below to see cable TV providers in your area.

What channel is the Denver Nuggets on?

For the 2025–2026 NBA season, you can watch the Denver Nuggets on the following channels:

  • Altitude
  • Altitude 2
  • NBA TV
  • ABC
  • NBC
  • ESPN
  • Amazon Prime
  • Peacock Premium

Altitude is the Nuggets’ regional sports network partner. If you’re in Colorado, Wyoming, Nebraska, or certain parts of Idaho and South Dakota, you’ll need the channel to watch the Nuggets. DIRECTV, Stream with DIRECTV, Fubo, and Spectrum all carry Altitude.

Pro tip: Want to watch every Nuggets game outside Altitude’s regional window? We recommend NBA League Pass or NBA Team Pass for out-of-market team coverage.

Denver Nuggets 2025–2026 TV schedule

The Denver Nuggets finished the regular season last year with a 50–32 record. They have a revamped roster that could mean more wins in 2025–2026, but several teams in the Western Conference got better.

Denver’s schedule isn’t doing them any favors. My biggest concerns are a stretch in November where five of their six games are on the road against some tough opponents, and a seven-game road trip in late December in a tight time window.

I’ve put the full Nuggets schedule below so it’s easier to digest.

Want to watch the Denver Nuggets for free? ABC and NBC will nationally broadcast multiple Nuggets games this season. You can watch these Nuggets games for free with an over-the-air antenna, which captures local broadcasts for networks like ABC and NBC.

Prefer to stream Nuggets games for free? DIRECTV STREAM and Fubo both have free trials, as does Amazon Prime Video, and you can give each service a spin to see how you like them. Check out our full Streaming Free Trials guide to learn more about both services.

How to watch the Denver Nuggets FAQ

How can I watch the Denver Nuggets game today?

Denver Nuggets games are available on channels including ABC, NBC, ESPN, NBA TV, and Altitude all season. Due to the NBA's new media deal that started in the 2025–2026, you can stream the Nuggets on Amazon Prime Video and Peacock's premium plans. I recommend DIRECTV STREAM or Fubo to stream most Denver Nuggets games.

Where can I watch the Nuggets game for free?

You can watch nationally broadcast Nuggets games on ABC and NBC for free with an OTA antenna. If you need to catch other games, we recommend getting a free trial for either DIRECTV STREAM, Fubo trial, or Amazon Prime Video.

What’s the Denver Nuggets’ G League team?

The Grand Rapids Gold is the Denver Nuggets’ NBA G League affiliate. You can watch the minor league team across NBA TV, The Roku Channel, Tubi, and ESPN platforms.

Are the Denver Nuggets on Amazon?

Yes, the Denver Nuggets will have at least five games stream on Amazon Prime Video during the 2025–2026 season.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com junior sports writer, Alex Vejar, analyzed the upcoming Denver Nuggets schedule to determine the best broadcast options. He also cross-referenced this information with our existing streaming and cord-cutter coverage to help you get the best deal on your NBA viewing package this year.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the Minnesota Timberwolves: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Finn
item.description:
Ready to howl for the Wolves? Our Minnesota Timberwolves watch guide includes the complete TV schedule, channel info, and expert tips for streaming every game.

The post How To Watch the Minnesota Timberwolves: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Minnesota Timberwolves have shed the “young upstart” label and are now a legitimate force in the West. After back-to-back Western Conference Finals appearances behind a dynamic duo of Anthony Edwards and Rudy Gobert, the Wolves are firmly in the championship conversation.

This offseason, Minnesota locked in key pieces to stay on the hunt. They solidified the frontcourt by extending Julius Randle and secured their bench anchor by signing Naz Reid to a massive new deal. They’re building a roster that can finally punch a ticket to the NBA Finals.

That championship-or-bust mentality is what will make it so exciting to watch the Minnesota Timberwolves this season. To help you follow along, I’ve created this complete guide to their TV schedule, channels, and streaming options.

Jump to:

  • Minnesota Timberwolves channels
  • Minnesota Timberwolves TV schedule
  • Best Timberwolves TV plans
  • Watch Timberwolves for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Minnesota Timberwolves games?

Locally, most regular-season Timberwolves games will air on FanDuel Sports Network North (FDSN), the team’s regional broadcast partner. If you’re outside the Minnesota market, you’ll need NBA League Pass to stay up-to-date with the team.

National broadcasts will appear on ABC, ESPN, NBC, and NBA TV. You’ll also find select games streaming exclusively on Amazon Prime Video and Peacock, thanks to a new NBA media deal.

Want radio coverage? The T-Wolves’ flagship radio station is KFAN 100.3 FM, which you can stream via the iHeartRadio app. You can also get every game with an NBA League Pass Audio subscription.

2025–2026 Minnesota Timberwolves TV schedule

After coming up short in two straight Western Conference Finals, it feels like the Timberwolves are just one step away from getting over the hump. I’m especially looking forward to their marquee matchups against rivals like the Nuggets and Grizzlies, which will be a huge test for this squad. Any bout between Edwards and Ja Morant is must-see TV.

To help you follow every moment of their journey, I’ve compiled the complete 2025–2026 Timberwolves TV schedule below. Hit the jump links to skip to whichever month you’re searching for, or just keep scrolling to find what you need.

Best TV plans for watching the Minnesota Timberwolves

Finding the right TV plan to watch the Timberwolves can be a real battle. But don’t worry, I’m here to make it Minnesota nice and simple. I’ve broken down my top recommendations for every type of fan.

For fans living in the team’s massive TV territory—which covers Minnesota, western Wisconsin, northern Iowa, and the Dakotas—your main target is FanDuel Sports Network North. My pick for the best all-in-one service is Stream with DIRECTV, as it bundles the RSN with all the national channels. On top of that, you’ll get unlimited DVR to record every game and mix channels for catching multiple live events simultaneously.

Some games will only stream on Amazon Prime Video and Peacock. For that reason, you’ll want to keep an eye on the schedule to know when you’ll need one of those subscriptions. But if you’re an out-of-market fan cheering from afar, NBA League Pass is key to watching every Wolves game not picked up locally or nationally.

Standalone in-market TV package for Wolves games

If you need a simple cable-free option, Wolves fans can cop a FanDuel Sports Network streaming subscription. It costs $19.99 per month and gives you direct access to FanDuel Sports Network North, the RSN home of most Wolves broadcasts.

A subscription also gets you a ton of team-focused content, including the Wolves Live pregame and postgame shows. It also works smoothly on major streaming platforms, like Amazon Fire TV, Apple TV, and Roku. But it’s important to note that year-long subscribers no longer get in-market Minnesota Twins games, as the MLB team has left the network.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Minnesota Timberwolves for free

Aren’t we all just trying to save a little money here and there when we can? Fortunately, there are ways to watch the Timberwolves without paying. Free trials from services like DIRECTV, Fubo, and YouTube TV give you access to nationally televised games for a limited time.

Meanwhile, a digital antenna can help you pick up some games over the air, even without a subscription. You’ll just want to use the FCC’s Reception Map Tool or Antenna Direct’s TV Transmitter Locator to verify which channels are available in your area. This season, ABC and NBC are scheduled to air several NBA games, so an antenna can be a great way to catch some of the action for free.

How to watch the Minnesota Timberwolves FAQ

Can I watch FanDuel Sports Network North without cable?

Nope, you don’t need cable to watch FanDuel Sports Network North. The regional sports network is available through select streaming platforms, including DIRECTV and Fubo. You can also stream it directly via the FanDuel Sports Network app if you’re in-market.

What’s the best streaming service for Timberwolves games?

DIRECTV is the most complete option for Wolves fans, as it includes FanDuel Sports Network North along with national channels like ABC, ESPN, and NBC. Fubo also offers a comparable channel lineup and similar plans. But DIRECTV has a more appealing interface and a better balance of sports and entertainment channels.

How can I watch the Timberwolves if I’m out of market?

If you’re outside the Timberwolves’ regional market, NBA League Pass is your go-to option for catching out-of-market games not nationally televised. Just keep in mind that blackout restrictions apply, like when the Wolves play your in-market team.

Who’s coaching the Timberwolves in 2025?

As of the 2025–2026 season, the Timberwolves are led by Chris Finch, who’s been at the helm since 2021. Finch has guided Minnesota to back-to-back Western Conference Finals. And with Anthony Edwards blossoming into a superstar, Finch’s system continues to maximize the Wolves’ blend of defense, depth, and athleticism.

Why you should trust us

CableTV.com contributor Creshonda Smith is a die-hard NBA fan who spent hours digging into the Timberwolves’ schedule, media deals, and TV options. She cross-checked every matchup and verified each channel to ensure you’re ready for game day.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025–2026 Brooklyn Nets Season
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Finn
item.description:
Don’t call it a comeback (yet), but the Brooklyn Nets are finally starting to look like a team with direction. And that makes them one of the more compelling squads to watch this season.

The post How To Watch the 2025–2026 Brooklyn Nets Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Brooklyn Nets have spent the last few seasons walking off the hangover from the biggest “what if” in recent NBA history. The superstar trio of Kevin Durant, Kyrie Irving, and James Harden was supposed to bring rings, and yet all it delivered was one playoff series win and a full-on roster reset.

But 2025 feels different. Brooklyn isn’t trying to sell you on a big three anymore. They’re betting on something less flashy but far more stable: development, depth, and smart front office moves.

They’ve stocked up on first-round picks, added intriguing pieces like Terance Mann, and re-signed core contributors like Day’Ron Sharpe while still leaving the door open for Cam Thomas to shine—or get flipped. Don’t call it a comeback (yet), but the Nets are finally starting to look like a team with direction. And that makes them one of the more compelling squads to watch this season.

Jump to:

  • Brooklyn Nets channels
  • Best Brooklyn Nets TV plans
  • Brooklyn Nets TV schedule
  • Watch Brooklyn Nets for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Brooklyn Nets games?

The Brooklyn Nets’ 2025–2026 season will be broadcast across a new and expanded mix of local, national, and streaming channels/platforms.

  • Locally: Fans in the New York area can watch most Nets games on YES Network and The Gotham Sports App.
  • Nationally: Nets broadcasts will air nationwide on ABC and ESPN, with NBC’s new Sunday Night Basketball and regional broadcasts also offering select matchups.
  • Streaming: For exclusive streaming games, you’ll need Amazon Prime Video for Thursday and Friday matchups, as well as the NBA Cup and NBA Play-In Tournament. Meanwhile, Peacock will carry Monday night NBA games and all games that air on NBC.

For fans outside the New York market, NBA League Pass remains the best option for watching out-of-market games not nationally televised, though blackout rules still apply.

Want radio coverage? The Brooklyn Nets games are broadcast live on WFAN 660 AM and 101.9 FM in New York. Chris Carrino and Tim Capstraw handle the play-by-play and commentary. You can also stream games without blackouts via NBA League Pass Audio for $9.99.

Best TV plans for watching the Brooklyn Nets

Thanks to the NBA’s newly expanded media rights deal, the best TV option to stay locked in must have a combo of regional and national access. Of course, that all depends on where you’re tuning in from.

Stream with DIRECTV and Fubo are my top picks for Nets fans because they both include YES Network for local broadcasts and cover the major national NBA channels like ESPN, NBC, and NBA TV. YouTube TV is often my go-to for NBA coverage, but the platform dropped YES Network in 2020 due to a contract dispute. Fortunately, DIRECTV and Fubo offer unlimited DVR storage and the option to add NBA League Pass for out-of-market coverage.

No matter which service you choose, you’ll still need Amazon Prime Video and Peacock for their streaming exclusives.

Standalone in-market TV package for Nets games

For in-market fans, the Gotham Sports App is the best option you have at your disposal. At $24.99 per month or $239.99 per year, it offers direct access to YES Network, so it’s the standalone option for watching Brooklyn Nets games without a traditional cable subscription. The app is available on iOS, Android, Roku, Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, and most web browsers, so fans have flexibility across devices.

The Gotham Sports App consolidates content from both YES Network and MSG Networks, streamlining the viewing experience for fans of multiple New York teams. Subscribers get access to live games, enhanced stats, loyalty rewards, and interactive features—all in one place.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

2025–2026 Brooklyn Nets TV schedule

The Brooklyn Nets are due for a shake-up. I mean, with all the unfortunate injuries and trades that have taken place, the East is wide open, and it’s an opportunity to get down to business.

Brooklyn has several chances to establish themselves, from facing tough conference teams to making a run in the Play-In Tournament and hopefully, the postseason. Whether you’re watching from home or at Barclays Center, the 2025–2026 season promises a packed calendar of thrilling basketball and nationally televised showdowns.

Check out the full 2025–2026 Nets TV schedule below. I’ll update this page as more game times and channel listings become available.

How to watch the Brooklyn Nets for free

Watching Brooklyn Nets games without spending a dime is possible if you take advantage of free trial offers and over-the-air access. Start with free trials from streaming platforms like DIRECTV, Fubo, and YouTube TV since each offers access to national broadcasters. These trials typically last from three to seven days, giving fans a solid shot to catch high-interest games at no cost.

If you’re located in the New York metro area, you might also be able to watch select games on ABC and NBC using a digital antenna, especially as the NBA’s new deal adds more free-to-air broadcasts. And don’t forget the NBA App, which sometimes features complimentary game streams and radio coverage for national matchups. Just double-check blackout rules because they might affect real-time access.

How to watch the Brooklyn Nets FAQ

Do I need cable to watch the Nets on YES Network?

No, you don’t need a cable subscription to watch YES Network. You can stream the regional sports network through services like DIRECTV and Fubo. The channel is also available as a standalone streaming subscription through The Gotham Sports App.

What’s the best streaming service for Brooklyn Nets games?

DIRECTV’s streaming service currently stands out for its extensive Brooklyn Nets coverage. It includes YES Network for local broadcasts alongside national channels like ESPN, NBC, and NBA TV. The service also offers the NBA League Pass add-on and a cloud DVR, making it a favorite among fans who don’t want to miss a game.

Can I watch the Brooklyn Nets on YES National?

No, YES Network’s national feed doesn’t show live Brooklyn Nets games beyond the New York TV market due to blackout restrictions. That’s where NBA League Pass steps in to provide out-of-market game access. Still, YES National carries other Nets programming—including studio shows and documentaries.

Who’s the head coach for the Brooklyn Nets?

As of the 2025 season, the Brooklyn Nets are coached by Jordi Fernández, who stepped in to lead the team with a defense-first philosophy and a strong background in player development. His approach has been pivotal in reshaping the team's post-trade era identity.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Contributing Writer, Creshonda Smith, spent dozens of hours sifting through broadcast schedules, blackout rules, team changes, and platform quirks to bring Brooklyn Nets fans a viewing blueprint.

She reviewed every matchup, confirmed every channel, and vetted every TV service. This is because our editorial team is passionate about giving you the tools to stay connected to the Nets all season long, so you know exactly where and when to tune in.

DIRECTV STREAM and DIRECTV have some excellent features, but they’re both way too expensive to be worth it for most folks. Forced to choose one over the other, we’d pick DIRECTV STREAM since it’s the most flexible (no contract means an easier escape) and avoids DIRECTV’s ridiculous second-year price hike.

Is Stream with DIRECTV or DIRECTV better?

When it comes to DIRECTV, I have years of experience using both the classic satellite dish setup and its streaming form, Stream with DIRECTV (formerly DIRECTV STREAM). Which one is better depends on your preferences.

Each DIRECTV service has identical high prices, two-year term agreements, and hidden fees that always seem to pop up. Also, both services are excellent for sports. The biggest differences are channel lineups, delivery method (satellite vs. streaming), devices (Genie or Gemini or Gemini Air) for live TV channels, movies, and shows.

I’ve enjoyed both feature-rich services, but if you forced me to choose, I’d go with Stream with DIRECTV. It’s just simpler to install and use—and cancel without a penalty. However, my overall recommendation is that DIRECTV plans change too frequently and its prices are much too high; you can often get more bang for your buck elsewhere. Check out YouTube TV or Hulu + Live TV or, if you’re still considering a satellite setup, DISH.

But maybe you’re not yet ready to turn your back on DIRECTV or Stream with DIRECTV—perhaps because you want to access the services’ top-shelf sportsball experience. If so, read on for a deeper comparison of both services.

Sponsored by DIRECTV

Binge-watch more of your favorite shows with DIRECTV

When the leaves fall, Fall TV shows drop—streaming with DIRECTV can make sure you catch them. New subscribers get three months of HBO Max™, Paramount+ with SHOWTIME, STARZ®, Cinemax®, and MGM+™ included with select packages (a $175 value).

You can watch a lot in three months, trust us, as professional TV watchers, the CableTV.com staff knows. Catch up on summer hits like The White Lotus and Dexter: Resurrection, and get into the new season of Peacemaker, or new shows like Outlander: Blood of My Blood and It: Welcome to Derry.

Sign up for a free trial today to see how DIRECTV is revolutionizing streaming TV with its Signature Packages, innovative Gemini streaming device, and curated Genre Packs. This is DIRECTV like you’ve never seen it.

What else is out there?

You can get streaming TV services wherever you can get a steady internet connection. Satellite TV services like DISH and DIRECTV are available almost anywhere. But cable TV providers’ availability depends on your location. Enter your zip code below to find providers in your area.

Compare Stream with DIRECTV and DIRECTV head to head

Provider Price* Connection type Channel count DVR storage Simultaneous recordings Details
Stream with DIRECTV
Best for flexibility 		$89.99–$169.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees Internet 90–185+ Unlimited for $10.00/mo. 5 View Plans for DIRECTV STREAM

Read Stream with DIRECTV Review
DIRECTV Satellite + Device
Best for DVR and features 		$89.99–$169.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees Satellite 165–340+ 200 hrs. (Genie) or 450 hrs. (Gemini) for $10.00/mo. 3 View Plans for DIRECTV

Read DIRECTV Review

Data effective as of post date. Not all offers are available in all areas. See full disclaimer for details.

Let’s recap the similarities and differences between Stream with DIRECTV and DIRECTV.

Stream with DIRECTV has 90–185+ channels—55% fewer than DIRECTV. That’s not such a big deal because the lineups are curated to include mostly popular channels—you won’t get as many filler channels as you find on DIRECTV.

Stream with DIRECTV connects to your home Wi-Fi network and delivers your channels via either the Gemini Air device (first one’s free), or one of several streaming devices that support the DIRECTV app.

DIRECTV has 165–340+ channels for close to the same prices as Stream with DIRECTV—and no more second-year price hike, thanks to DIRECTV’s two-year price guarantee. But that guarantee comes with a two-year contract where you can cancel early, but it’ll cost you $20 per remaining month.

Pro tip: If DIRECTV’s traditional plans are too expensive, but you like the brand, check out DIRECTV’s Genre Packs. These themed packages are dedicated to entertainment, kids, news, and sports content, featuring smaller price tags. They also have fewer channels—but more of the ones you want—and some even include streaming services like Disney+, ESPN+, Hulu, and HBO Max.

If satellite TV is your only option, the more affordable DISH Network has slightly fewer channels than DIRECTV, but almost as many sports networks and add-ons. DISH also has the more powerful Hopper 3 DVR ($10.00 a month) and also guarantees your monthly payment for two years.

However, as I mentioned, I steer people away from DIRECTV services and towards live TV streaming services like YouTube TV or Hulu + Live TV. While they have fewer channels than Stream with DIRECTV and DIRECTV, I’ve found they offer better overall value with better affordability, no hidden fees, curated lineups of popular channels, and free unlimited cloud DVR storage.

Pro tip: Check out our guide to the Hidden Costs of DIRECTV, which explains all of the service’s various hidden charges, including fees for activation, devices, early cancellation, late payments, local channels, and more.

Stream with DIRECTV vs. DIRECTV prices and plans: Both are expensive

Stream with DIRECTV and DIRECTV have four separate plans with similar monthly payments—but wildly divergent channel counts. Let’s see how they rate in terms of overall value.

Stream with DIRECTV pricing and plans

Package Price* Channel count Popular channels Details
Stream with DIRECTV ENTERTAINMENT $89.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees 90+ AMC, CNN, ESPN, Hallmark Channel, HGTV, MSNBC, Nickelodeon, and TLC View Plan
Stream with DIRECTV CHOICE™ $94.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees 125+ Bravo, Disney, IFC, Nick Jr., OWN, Science, Travel Channel, and UniMás View Plan
Stream with DIRECTV ULTIMATE $124.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees 160+ Magnolia Network, Golf Channel, LOGO, Nat Geo WILD, NHL Network, and Universal Kids View Plan
Stream with DIRECTV PREMIER $169.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees 185+ CINEMAX®, STARZ®, Paramount+ with SHOWTIME®, and HBO MaxTM View Plan

Data effective as of post date. Not all offers are available in all areas. See full disclaimer for details.

All live TV streaming services, not just Stream with DIRECTV, have fewer channels than cable and satellite TV services. So it’s not like Stream with DIRECTV is trying to give you less for your money. It’s how live TV streaming services roll—they offer quality over quantity or more popular channels instead of filler networks.

Stream with DIRECTV CHOICE™ ($94.99/mo., 125+ channels) has the best value at $0.72 per channel. With CHOICE™ and ULTIMATE ($124.99/mo., 160 channels) packages, new customers get three free months of CINEMAX, MGM+, HBO Max, Paramount+ Premium (formerly Paramount+ with SHOWTIME), and STARZ. But if you go with PREMIER ($169.99/mo., 185+ channels), those premium channels are a permanent part of your plan.

See All DIRECTV Streaming Channels

DIRECTV Satellite pricing and plans

Package Price* Channel count Popular channels Details
ENTERTAINMENT All Included $89.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees 165+ AMC, CNN, ESPN, Hallmark Channel, HGTV, MSNBC, Nickelodeon, and TLC View Plan
CHOICE™ All Included $94.99/mo. for 24 mos. plus taxes and fees 200+ Bravo, Disney, IFC, Nick Jr., OWN, Science, Travel Channel, and UniMás View Plan

Data effective as of post date. Not all offers are available in all areas. See full disclaimer for details.

DIRECTV and Stream with DIRECTV packages are essentially the same in terms of popular channels. The difference is that Stream with DIRECTV packages cut out the filler channels you’ll probably never watch.

Both providers now charge close to the same price for their plans—but the channel counts are vastly different, as I’ve shown.

See All DIRECTV Satellite Channels

Stream with DIRECTV and DIRECTV have different equipment and DVR storage

When it comes to DVRs, the DIRECTV Genie (200 hours) and Genie 2 (450 hours) are powerful units with limited streaming app support. That said, the DIRECTV Gemini (450–unlimited hours) and Gemini Air (unlimited hours) aren’t as feature-rich as the Genies, but their accompanying cloud DVR storage is much greater. Check out each device’s vital statistics below.

Stream with DIRECTV vs. DIRECTV DVR

DVR Price Storage Simultaneous recordings Video quality Streaming app support Details
Stream with DIRECTV Gemini Air (optional) $10.00/mo. Unlimited (cloud) 3 Up to 4K Disney+, ESPN, Hulu, HBO Max, Paramount+, Peacock View Plans for DIRECTV
DIRECTV Genie $10.00/mo. 200 hrs. (physical) 5 Up to 4K HBO Max, Netflix, Pandora View Plans for DIRECTV
DIRECTV Genie 2 (wireless) $10.00/mo. 450 hrs. (cloud) 7 Up to 4K HBO Max, Netflix, Pandora View Plans for DIRECTV
DIRECTV Gemini $10.00/mo. 450 hrs.–unlimited (cloud) 3 Up to 4K Disney+, ESPN, Hulu, HBO Max, Netflix, Paramount+, Peacock, Prime Video View Plans for DIRECTV

Data effective as of post date. Not all offers are available in all areas. See full disclaimer for details.

Stream with DIRECTV‘s Gemini Air and cloud DVR

When you sign up for Stream with DIRECTV, you can choose to use the service’s new Gemini Air device ($10.00 per month), which includes a universal voice remote, support for most major streaming apps, and unlimited DVR. Or you can save ten bucks a month by using one of the many streaming devices, smartphones, or tablets that you probably already own—and already support the DIRECTV app.

Unlimited cloud DVR has a nine-month keep time for recordings, and that sure beats Stream with DIRECTV‘s old cloud DVR offer: A measly 20 hours free or unlimited storage for $10.00 a month, with only a 90-day keep time. It’s also infinitely more DVR storage than you get with the Genies.

DIRECTV Genie DVRs and wireless Gemini

If you like to keep movies, shows, and sporting events to watch at your leisure, the best option is DIRECTV’s Genie (200 hours, five simultaneous recordings) or wireless Genie 2 (450 hours, three simultaneous recordings). The Genie DVRs don’t auto-delete your recordings unless you’re out of storage.

The basic Genie (wired) has enough storage and tuners for most users. The Genie 2 is best for committed couch creatures and their binge-watching habits, and the unit is wireless so you can avoid cable clutter. Another wireless option is the Gemini (different from the Gemini Air), which includes a universal voice remote, streaming app support, and 450 hours of cloud DVR storage.

If you have multiple TVs, you can add DIRECTV on up to seven more screens in your home with additional Genie or Gemini devices ($10.00 a month each). To learn more about DIRECTV whole-home DVR, check out our DIRECTV Genie review.

Stream with DIRECTV vs. DIRECTV installation = simple vs complicated

Installing and setting up Stream with DIRECTV is a breeze. In fewer than five minutes, I downloaded the app to my Roku Ultra and smartphone, signed in, and started browsing what to watch while also building my watchlist. (Note: We haven’t tested the Gemini Air device. When we do, we’ll update this article. For now, it’s safe to assume the set-up process will be just as easy.)

The installation process is much more complicated, and potentially frustrating, with DIRECTV’s satellite service. It required setting up an install appointment where a technician installed the dish on my roof, drilled cable holes into my house, and set up my Genie DVR. That involved taking time off work and took significantly longer to complete. Also, apartment dwellers may need to have their landlord sign an installation approval form. On the bright side, installation is free of charge.

Stream with DIRECTV vs DIRECTV: Two services, one streaming app

Comparing Stream with DIRECTV‘s and DIRECTV’s apps is a little tricky. Allow us to elaborate.

Stream with DIRECTV app

All streaming services are based around an app that you use on a compatible device like a Chromecast, gaming console, personal computer, smart TV, smartphone, streaming stick, or tablet. So, whereas the DIRECTV app is an extra way to enjoy your DIRECTV package on the go, the Stream with DIRECTV mobile app is the main way to use the service.

When I put the Stream with DIRECTV app to the test, I quickly understood why it boasts such high ratings—4.6 out of 5.0 on both Google Play and the Apple App Store. From my perspective, the app consistently delivered an easy, intuitive user experience across every platform I tried.

One of the first things that struck me was the app’s incredible device compatibility. I found it worked seamlessly with my Android and iOS devices, Amazon Fire TV sticks, Apple TV, Chromecast, NVIDIA Shield, and even my Roku. I also experimented with it on my Google and Roku smart TVs, as well as various internet browsers, and had no issues whatsoever. It’s safe to say you probably already own something that works with it.

Now, on the downside, I was a bit disappointed to discover there’s no gaming console support. As a gamer, that’s a feature I’d love to see in the future. But I was pleasantly surprised to find that the app is compatible with the Apple Vision Pro virtual reality device and even select Peloton models, which is a nice touch.

The DIRECTV device compatibility page offers all the nitty-gritty details like specific model numbers and operating system requirements.

Stream with DIRECTV vs. DIRECTV FAQ

How much does DIRECTV's streaming plans cost?

Stream with DIRECTV has four plans priced $89.99–$169.99/mo. a month for 90–185+ channels.

Can I stream DIRECTV if I have DIRECTV?

You can stream your DIRECTV live channels, on-demand content, and DVR recordings with the DIRECTV App, which is free to current DIRECTV subscribers.

Is DIRECTV streaming worth it?

If you’re asking about the Stream with DIRECTV live TV streaming service, we think it’s too expensive to be worth it, unless you're a sports lover. But if you’re asking about streaming DIRECTV through its mobile app, we think it adds a ton of value to your DIRECTV subscription.

How much does DIRECTV cost after one year?

DIRECTV no longer has a second-year price hike—the satellite TV provider now offers a two-year price guarantee. Current DIRECTV prices are $89.99–$169.99/mo..

Does DIRECTV have a 2-year price lock?

Yes, DIRECTV finally has a two-year price guarantee. DISH, however, has a three-year price lock.

Why you should trust us

At CableTV.com, we constantly analyze prices, plans, and specifications of TV providers like Stream with DIRECTV and DIRECTV so our readers can make informed buying decisions. We’ve also tested Stream with DIRECTV and DIRECTV from signup through activation, and surveyed other customers to see what they thought about providers. To learn more about our process, see our How We Rank page.

item.title: Spectrum Customers, You Can Cancel Your Disney+ Subscription Now
item.dc:creator: Olivia Bono
item.description:
If you’re a Spectrum TV customer, you may be over-paying for your streaming services. So dig up your password book and get cancellin’.

The post Spectrum Customers, You Can Cancel Your Disney+ Subscription Now appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
And Hulu too, while you’re at it.

Customers have been cancelling Disney+ in droves recently for two reasons. One, because ABC temporarily suspended Jimmy Kimmel Live! after he criticized the Republican Party. And two, because Disney recently announced plans to raise its prices by $2–$3, which it’s done every year since 2022. Those years have really been adding up.

But there’s a new reason you can cancel your Disney+ subscription now, although I’m using the term “cancel” loosely. If you’re a Spectrum TV customer, you may be overpaying for your streaming services. So dig up your password book and get cancellin’.

Stay in the loop with CableTV.com

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest TV-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

Spectrum just added Hulu to its already-great TV bundle

You might not have known that Spectrum TV packages came with free streaming services. Until recently, Spectrum offered its customers free Disney+, but not Hulu, so customers couldn’t benefit from Disney Bundle savings. They had to subscribe to Hulu separately, which we generally don’t recommend doing.

But Hulu isn’t going to exist as a standalone service for very much longer and is going to become part of Disney+ in 2026. Maybe that’s why Spectrum decided to take the plunge and start offering Hulu as part of its TV packages, too. That means Spectrum TV customers are now getting free Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+ (through Unlimited), and HBO Max, eliminating the need for the Disney Bundle. You might as well call it the Spectrum Bundle.

So if you’re a Spectrum TV customer, go ahead and activate your new cable-sponsored subscriptions. You should be able to log in to each platform with your Spectrum credentials. And then go through our list of streaming services below and cancel any standalone plans or bundles you had before. You don’t want to be paying for the same thing more than once, especially not with these rising prices.

(Unfortunately, this does make it harder to boycott Disney products. So here’s hoping ABC doesn’t try to censor any other comedians in the near future.)

Every streaming service included with Spectrum TV

Here’s every streaming service included with Spectrum TV plans:

  • Hulu
  • Disney+
  • HBO Max
  • ESPN Unlimited
  • Paramount+
  • Peacock
  • FOX ONE
  • AMC+
  • Tennis Channel
  • Vix

Offerings may vary between plans. Also, you’ll be getting the ad-supported version of each service, and you’ll miss out on any other premium upgrades like 4K streaming, where applicable.

Why you should trust us

At CableTV.com, we keep a watchful eye on streaming and entertainment news. When there are deals to be had, we swoop in and let you know about them. It’s kind of our thing. We’re equal opportunity binge-ers, by the way—we love both cable and streaming TV. For more about who we are, head over to our About Us page. For more on what we do, check out How We Rank.

Related articles

  • Netflix and YouTube Save Sesame Street
  • The State of Late-Night TV
  • Why Are People Cancelling Netflix?

item.title: Best College Football Games Today on TV | Week 7 2025
item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Don’t miss a snap! Find the full Week 7 schedule for watching college football today on TV. We cover channel lineups and which games are must-watch matchups.

The post Best College Football Games Today on TV | Week 7 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Nothing’s guaranteed these days, folks.

You can plan things out to a T, drop the checkbook, and make backup plans for your backup plans. But when push comes to shove, there’s no way to ensure you aren’t sending out the apology letters after your team comes up short. (This goes ninefold if you’ve overseen the worst regular-season loss in college football history since, arguably, the Reagan administration.)

What can you do if your team’s already looking into the playoff void at this season’s midpoint? Take that vacation! Go for it on fourth down! Check out the 10:00 a.m. Ludacris concert instead of studying for your midterms! If last weekend’s games taught us anything, there’s nothing wrong with being here for a good time.

For the Week 7 edition of the CableTV.com College Football What to Watch Guide, we’ll warm up the deep fryer, repeat ourselves yet again, and take the over.

Jump to:

  • CableTV.com’s Game of the Week
  • Week 7’s best college football games
  • College football Week 7 TV schedule

Interested in college football games today?

Subscribe to our email newsletter for the latest football takes, TV subscription deals, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

CableTV.com’s Game of the Week

Watch Indiana vs. Oregon | CBS

If you’re looking for a new Vibes Playoff Team after last weekend’s Penn State and Texas flameouts, may we suggest Top-10 Indiana?

For starters, Curt Cignetti continues to be one of the Big Ten’s top coaches in terms of Being A Hater and intensity. Plus, this year’s 5–0 Hoosiers squad is even better than last year’s squad in a few respects: Fernando Mendoza is one of the nation’s best quarterbacks, and they’re up to third nationally in ESPN’s SP+ thanks to blowout wins over Kennesaw State, Indiana State, and Illinois.

This week’s Oregon game gives the Hoosiers another chance to shake one of Cignetti’s few bugaboos: their record against elite competition. Dante Moore’s been an excellent first-year triggerman for the Oregon offense, and the Ducks held off Penn State in double overtime during Week 5’s 30–24 win. By comparison, the Hoosiers have yet to shake the specter of 2024 Indiana’s “good try, good effort” losses to Ohio State and Notre Dame.

At the moment, Oregon, Indiana, and Ohio State sit atop the Big Ten standings, and the winner of Saturday’s game will likely face Ohio State in Indianapolis. Despite Oregon’s name-brand recognition, they’re only favored by a touchdown over the Hoosiers, and it’s a virtual toss-up by the advanced stats.

How to stream #7 Indiana at #3 Oregon

vs.

Date: Saturday, Oct. 11
Time: 3:30 p.m. ET
Channel: CBS
Location: Autzen Stadium in Eugene, Ore.
Point spread: Oregon by 7.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Based in Indianapolis, Homefield offers officially licensed college apparel with exclusive vintage designs that draw from the history of more than 150 colleges. This week’s Homefield picks highlight vault pulls, bomber jackets, and more from Homefield’s Indiana and Oregon collections.

Want to upgrade your gameday fit? Click the link below to check out Homefield’s collections, and use promo code CABLETV to save 15% off your first order.

Buy Homefield College Football Shirts

Week 7’s best college football games to watch: weeknights

Watch Missouri State vs. Middle Tennessee | ESPN2

The Bears are working through their share of growing pains in their first FBS season in Conference USA. After opening the season with a 60-point loss to USC, they snagged a solid win over Marshall alongside a competitive loss to Western Kentucky. This week, they’ll try to rack up another win against a moribund Middle Tennessee squad.

How to stream Missouri State vs. Middle Tennessee

vs.

Time: 7:30 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN2
Location: Johnny Floyd Stadium in Murfreesboro, Tenn.
Point spread: Missouri State by 2.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch South Florida vs. North Texas | ESPN2

Last one surviving in the American Conference gets the playoff bid? The Bulls and Mean Green are right behind Navy and Memphis in the American standings and just ahead of Tulane—all five squads are right in the thick of the conference race.

North Texas has one of the nation’s most prolific offenses, while USF’s win over Florida looks even better after last weekend. (Does this give the Bulls a transitive win over Texas and mean Byrum Brown is a better quarterback than Arch Manning? Sure!)

How to stream South Florida at North Texas

vs.

Week 7’s best games: Saturday morning

Watch Ohio State vs. Illinois | FOX

The Illinois Playoff Dark Horse campaign took on a lot of water after they got disemboweled by Indiana. Although the Illini rebounded with wins over USC and Purdue, their season’s ceiling hinges on this week’s game against Ohio State. (No pressure!)

The Buckeyes have yet to break a sweat in Big Ten conference play, as they took care of business against Washington and paved over Minnesota last weekend. Julian Sayin also has the Ohio State offense running at peak efficiency, as his 65% passing success rate ranks first nationally.

Watch Pitt vs. Florida State | ESPN

After slogging through losses to West Virginia and Louisville, Pitt swapped out incumbent quarterback Eli Holstein for freshman Mason Heintschel. Against Boston College, Heintschel went off for four touchdowns and 323 yards in a 48–7 win. This week, Pitt will face off against a reeling Florida State team that just dropped games to Virginia and Miami.

Week 7’s best games: Saturday afternoon

Watch Oklahoma vs. Texas | ABC

Haters of the Manning Industrial Complex, take note: this year’s edition of the Red River Rivalry may be the last occasion to dedicate serious airtime to Texas and Arch Manning this year. After its uninspiring Ohio State and Florida losses, Texas is all but out of the playoff race.

Oklahoma likely won’t have John Mateer (who’s still recovering from hand surgery) under center, but backup Michael Hawkins Jr. had no problem with Kent State last week. Plus, the Sooners also got long-awaited reps in for transfer running back Jaydn Ott—he ran for 49 yards on 11 carries.

Watch Air Force vs. UNLV | CBS Sports Network

Air Force was on the opposite end of last weekend’s most entertaining game, as the Falcons went for 460 total yards in a 34–31 loss to Navy. They’ll try to make up for it this week against a 5–0 UNLV team that’s holding down the fort for the Mountain West’s playoff reputation.

Watch Kansas vs. Texas Tech | FOX

Texas Tech is already a frontrunner in the Big 12 race, but thanks to Cincinnati’s upset win over Iowa State, they’re now sitting atop the conference standings. This week, they’ll face off against a tricky Kansas team that embodies Big 12 Chaotic Energy in more than a few ways—they’re ranked 44th nationally in points scored and points allowed.

Watch Michigan vs. USC | NBC

Speaking of hyped first-year quarterbacks, Michigan’s been the definition of a transitional team during Bryce Underwood’s first year under center. The 4–1 Wolverines have leaned on a streaky running game to make up for a fine-enough defense and a receiving room that’s led by converted quarterback Donaven McCulley.

As for USC, the 4–1 Trojans are once again a typical “elite offense, defense is also here” Lincoln Riley outfit. They narrowly dropped last week’s Illinois game in a 34–32 loss and will face off against Notre Dame next week in a three-game gauntlet against ranked teams.

Watch Florida vs. Texas A&M | ESPN

A few things are certainties in life: death, taxes, and Billy Napier pulling off mid-season wins that’ll make everyone involved furious. Florida’s big win over Texas was fueled by wide receiver Dallas Wilson giving the Gators offense another gear—Wilson went for 111 yards and two touchdowns on six receptions.

By comparison, the Aggies have been more methodical en route to their 5–0 start. They’ve taken down Notre Dame, Auburn, and Mississippi State with an offense and defense that rank 17th in SP+.

item.title: How To Watch the Charlotte Hornets: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Finn
item.description:
Welcome to Buzz City! Here’s how to watch every Charlotte Hornets game on TV. Our guide has the complete 2025–2026 TV schedule and must-have streaming info.

The post How To Watch the Charlotte Hornets: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Charlotte Hornets entered last season with modest expectations, but even those slipped away after injuries and inconsistency derailed their campaign. They finished near the bottom of the Eastern Conference, showing flashes of promise but never quite sustaining momentum.

This offseason, Charlotte focused on shoring up its roster around cornerstone LaMelo Ball, who’s expected back after missing significant time with ankle issues. The Hornets locked in Brandon Miller, fresh off a strong rookie showing, and added veteran guard Spencer Dinwiddie to provide stability and leadership on a young roster. Meanwhile, Miles Bridges returned on a new deal, giving the team a reliable scoring punch. The team also brought in Collin Sexton as another ball handler and Pat Connaughton via trade, adding depth and experience across the board.

The hype around Charlotte this year isn’t about championships; it’s about growth. Fans want to see the young guys gel and take a step forward, with playoff contention as the ultimate goal.

Jump to:

  • Charlotte Hornets channels
  • Charlotte Hornets TV schedule
  • Best Charlotte Hornets TV plans
  • Watch Charlotte Hornets for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Charlotte Hornets games

You can follow the Charlotte Hornets all season long across a mix of local networks, national broadcasters, and streaming platforms.

  • Locally: In-market fans can catch most Hornets games on FanDuel Sports Network Southeast (FDSSE). The channel is available through select cable providers and streaming services, including the standalone FanDuel Sports Network app.
  • Nationally: You’ll need ABC, ESPN, NBC, and NBA TV in your TV lineup to watch national NBA broadcasts. But don’t expect to see the Hornets on those channels much at all.
  • Streaming: Amazon Prime Video will stream Thursday and Friday night games, including NBA Cup contests and the Play-In Tournament. Meanwhile, Peacock has Monday night games and simulcasts of NBC’s national broadcasts.

For the fans outside the Carolinas market, NBA League Pass is the only way to watch Hornets games not airing nationally. Though standard blackout rules still apply, like when the Hornets play your in-market team.

Want radio coverage? The Charlotte Hornets broadcast every game live on 92.7 FM WFNZ. Fans across North Carolina can also tune in through the Hornets Radio Network, which includes several affiliate stations statewide.

2025–2026 Charlotte Hornets TV schedule

The Charlotte Hornets seemed to have a renewed sense of direction at the beginning of last season. But after a tough year marred by injuries, let’s hope they’re back with a sharpened focus and a roster ready to get to it.

The front office is prioritizing stability this season. The big question is whether this is another “Trust the Process” situation or if LaMelo and the crew are ready to take that next leap.

We all know that their superstar can get hot offensively like nobody’s business. But if everyone doesn’t step up to the plate, it feels like it’ll just be another stagnant season for the Hornets. With a healthy core and calculated moves, the Hornets are aiming to elevate their game and inch closer to playoff contention.

Here’s the full Hornets TV schedule so you don’t miss any of their games.

Best TV plans for watching the Charlotte Hornets

Following the Charlotte Hornets throughout the season means having the right mix of local and national TV access. The most reliable all-in-one choice is Stream with DIRECTV, which includes FanDuel Sports Network Southeast and key national channels. That’ll cover you during the Hornets’ midweek grind or a prime-time showdown. Fubo also offers NBA coverage, though its pricing shifts more often. Both services come with unlimited DVR.

If you’re an out-of-market fan, you’ll need to add an NBA League Pass subscription to your viewing roster. And to be a true completist, don’t forget you’ll also need separate subscriptions to Amazon Prime Video and Peacock for their exclusive slates of games.

Plan

Cord-cutters in the Charlotte area have a great standalone option for watching the Hornets. You can subscribe directly to the FanDuel Sports Network streaming service for $19.99 per month. This will get you a live feed of FanDuel Sports Network Southeast, the home of every local Hornets broadcast. You’ll just need to verify your zip code on their site first to confirm you’re in the correct TV market.

The value for Carolina sports fans is excellent. For a higher price, you can even tack on a FanDuel Sports Network South subscription, which bundles in additional Carolina Hurricanes and Atlanta Braves coverage. The app is available on all major streaming devices and is a great way to stay up-to-date with watching your local teams.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Charlotte Hornets for free

Yes, you can watch the Charlotte Hornets this season without paying. But you’ll need to take advantage of trial periods and over-the-air options. Several streaming platforms, including DIRECTV, Fubo, and YouTube TV, typically offer free trials that last three days or more. That’s a perfect window if you want to catch a big Hornets matchup without committing long-term.

If you live in the Charlotte region, you can also tune into select Hornets games on WSOC-TV (channel 9) or TV 64 using a digital antenna. Because of the NBA’s new TV deal, more nationally-televised games than ever will be on over-the-air channels, giving you a great way to watch without a TV subscription.

How to watch the Charlotte Hornets FAQ

Do I need cable to watch in-market Hornets games?

No, you don’t need a cable subscription. Hornets fans can stream FanDuel Sports Network Southeast through services like DIRECTV and Fubo. You can also subscribe directly to the app, which offers local Hornets game coverage on iOS, Android, Roku, Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, and most web browsers.

What’s the best streaming service for watching Hornets games?

DIRECTV’s streaming service is the most complete choice for Hornets fans. It carries FanDuel Sports Network Southeast for local broadcasts and includes national channels like ABC and ESPN. Fubo is another excellent choice with a similar package, but out-of-market fans will need NBA League Pass.

Where do the Charlotte Hornets play home games?

The Charlotte Hornets compete in the Southeast Division of the Eastern Conference. The team plays its home games at the Spectrum Center.

Who’s the current head coach of the Charlotte Hornets?

The Charlotte Hornets are led by head coach Charles Lee, who was hired in May 2024 after serving as an assistant with the Milwaukee Bucks and Boston Celtics. Lee brings a fresh perspective and defensive mindset as he guides a young roster into a new era.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Contributing Writer, Creshonda Smith, put in the legwork to craft this guide specifically for Charlotte Hornets fans. She dug through TV listings, streaming service lineups, and blackout rules to make sure you know exactly where to find every game.

At CableTV.com, our mission is simple: give Hornets fans the most accurate, up-to-date information so they can focus on watching LaMelo Ball, Brandon Miller, and the rest of the squad chase wins. To learn more about the methods we use to create our guides, check out our How We Rank page.
